title: Ghost Simulator
blurb: You're a ghost and kids are in your house! You need to scare them away!

team.name: Kathleen Kamali
team.about: I was team lead, idea person and Unity dev.

team.name: Joe Marchuk
team.about: I took care of sound design, music, and audio implementation! I created a music system that layers instruments as the player scares more children. There's also a theremin melody that plays while the player is using their mic input to move around the level. In addition, I created a sound system that creates a more immersive environment by having dynamic sound effects that randomize and react to player actions.

team.name: Dan Donato
team.about: Code, and designed the "spooky" object interactions. My favorite was the hands reaching out of the walls.

content_html:
Inspiration

Halloween's just around the corner! It's time to scare children and be festive!

What it does

It's a first person horror game, where you are the horror. You also control your ghostly corporeal form with your voice. Say "boooooooo" and watch yourself fly.

How we built it

We used Unity and the available Oculus SDK to build this game.

Challenges we ran into

Slight differences between the two dev computers led to strange bugs.

Accomplishments that we're proud of

Alternate control schemes are the best!

What we learned

The right source control is important. Microphone input isn't that bad to set up!
